guidesPageSubtitle: Meet the loving hands and hearts that will accompany you on your healing journey.
ayahuascaInfoTitle: The Ancestral Medicine: What is Ayahuasca and How Does it Work?
whatIsAyahuascaDescription: Ayahuasca is an ancestral beverage used by indigenous cultures of the Amazon for healing and spiritual purposes. It is made from the combination of two plants: the Ayahuasca vine (Banisteriopsis caapi) and other plants.
howAyahuascaWorksDescription: Ayahuasca acts as an inner guide, facilitating the exploration of consciousness and access to deep knowledge about oneself and the universe. Its purpose is to help you cleanse the body, release stagnant emotions, and reconnect with your true essence.
spiritualMasterDescription: Ayahuasca helps you reconnect with your inner self, with nature, and with the divine. It facilitates the expansion of consciousness and the development of intuition. Through the ceremony, you can experience a deep connection with ancestral wisdom and the vital energy of the universe.
ceremonyBenefitsTitle: Benefits of the Ceremony: Clarity, Healing, and Liberation
ayahuascaBenefitClarityDescription: Gain a greater understanding of yourself, your motivations, and your purpose in life through deep and revealing visions.
ayahuascaBenefitHealingDescription: Release traumas, fears, and emotional blockages that prevent you from moving forward on your path, healing past wounds and opening space for love and compassion.
ayahuascaBenefitConnectionDescription: Ayahuasca helps you reconnect with nature, value life, and understand the importance of caring for the planet. It facilitates the development of ecological awareness and a commitment to sustainability.
groupCeremonyDescription: Live a transformative group experience (from 3 to 12 people), where the bond between participants is strengthened and a powerful collective energy is generated. Includes breakfast and lodging in a cozy cabin in Chachagua, San Carlos or Guanacaste Casa Trinitos, surrounded by nature.
privateCeremonyDescription: We also offer individual ceremonies, tailored to your needs, with deep and personalized guidance. The location is chosen together, creating an intimate and sacred space for your healing process.
preparationCtaDescription: Proper preparation is essential to get the most out of your experience. Discover the steps to align your body, mind, and spirit before the ceremony.
preparationProcessDescription: Diet and mental readiness are key before the ceremony.
ceremonyProcessDescription: A sacred space of respect, safety, and containment.
experienceProcessDescription: Each journey is unique, with visions and intense emotions.
integrationProcessDescription: We offer support to process and apply the teachings.
dietSubtitle: A special diet is key for preparation. Learn about the allowed and prohibited foods before the ceremony.
allowedFoodsList: Grains (rice, lentils, chickpeas, quinoa, oats, etc.)
Pure water (ideally filtered or spring water)
prohibitedFoodsList: Processed foods and fast food (canned, fried, industrial snacks)
mentalPrepSubtitle: Meditation and setting intentions are fundamental. Prepare your mind and heart for the experience.
emotionalHealingDescription: Ayahuasca facilitates the healing of emotional traumas and the release of blockages that hinder your personal growth. Through the ceremony, you can access repressed memories, understand the origin of your emotional wounds, and release pain and suffering. The facilitators accompany you in this process, offering support and containment. It allows for deep transformation and the reconstruction of a full and meaningful life, free from the burdens of the past.
whatToBringSubtitle: Here is a list of items to ensure your comfort and well-being during the ceremony.
comfortItemsList: Mat or sleeping pad (yoga or camping style)
essentialsList: Notebook or journal for your reflections
Object with meaning for your altar or intention (optional)
